place.name: WILCRICK
place.gazetteerText: WILERICK, or Wilcrick, a parish in Newport district, Monmouth: 1¼ mile NW of Magor r. station, and 6½ E of Newport. Post town, Magor, under Chepstow. Acres, 406. Real property, £568. Pop., 28. Houses, 4. The living is a rectory, annexed to Llanmartin. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
